sect3.title: Evolution
sect3.para: GNOME &version; now includes Evolution 2.0, the integrated Email and Groupware client. Evolution supports traditional mail setups, as well as Novell Groupwise and Microsoft Exchange. With Evolution you can read, write, and manage your emails, contacts, and calendar events.

Evolution is already well known and succesful, but this new version has some extra features:
Support for multiple backends, so you can work with email and appointments from more than one server.
Support for online calendars, in the iCalendar format. TODO: Is it iCalendar and/or Webcal? TODO: How do you actually do this in evo?

sect3.title: Web Browser
sect3.para: GNOME's Epiphany web browser has some more enhancements.

Improvements include:
Popup windows can now be blocked for specific web sites.
There is now an offline mode .
Epiphany can now import its own bookmarks format.
